title: Does anything positive come from this sub-board?

replies.body:
I won't sugar coat it, 90%+ of the stuff we get here on the PB boards is exactly what you described. However, for the 10% that actually need assistance, we're always glad to help.

 I personally dislike it when these posts are downvoted. There are some cases (like where the poster is toxic towards everyone and won't listen to reason) where downvoting is expected/understandable, but the majority of posts don't deserve it. These posts are usually just people asking for help and clarification on what's punishable. 

 If you go down into the comment sections of the posts themselves, a lot of positive feedback is given and I've personally had a few heart-to-hearts with posters.

> [{quoted}](name=Hotarµ,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=q4W3wWE1,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-01-19T08:39:52.400+0000)

There are some cases (like where the poster is toxic towards everyone and won't listen to reason) where downvoting is expected/understandable, but the majority of posts don't deserve it. These posts are usually just people asking for help and clarification on what's punishable. 
> 
>  If you go down into the comment sections of the posts themselves, a lot of positive feedback is given and I've personally had a few heart-to-hearts with posters.

It's not 90% junk and 10% people who need assistance; it's 90% junk and 10% that's a mix of people who:

* know they broke the rules and want to tell us their story as a form of apology or warning to others
* think they're being clever by posting a "here's how to follow the rules" thread
* have suggestions about the PB system that have already been tried and proven ineffective

I don't think I've ever seen something along the lines of:

-"I got punished for my behavior. What'd I do wrong in this chat log?"
-"You called for reports several times, which is considered harassment and doesn't even affect report weight."
-"Oh! I didn't know it was ineffective, and I didn't realize it was hurtful! I feel bad about hurting others, and I will correct this behavior in the future."

If you haven't seen those types of responses then you aren't sticking around long enough in the threads themselves. There are the occasional threads where someone shows they want to reform, apologizes for their actions, and/or asks for help on how to do it. 

 It's infrequent, but they're there.

> [{quoted}](name=Hotarµ,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=q4W3wWE1,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2019-01-19T15:35:34.637+0000)
>
> If you haven't seen those types of responses then you aren't sticking around long enough in the threads themselves. There are the occasional threads where someone shows they want to reform, apologizes for their actions, and/or asks for help on how to do it. 
> 
>  It's infrequent, but they're there.

I don't view _everything_, of course, but I see whatever pops up in the Recent view, and I generally stay until the OP starts violating Boards rules or a mod locks the thread for being a waste of time. I do see the "I got banned, sorry, I messed up, but I'll try to do better threads, but they're always like that from the beginning. I don't recall any instances of an argumentative "why'd I get banned, what BS" thread becoming constructive and the OP seeing reason after hearing the same old thing from the regulars.

I don't think anyone's saying that there has literally 100% never been a single worthwhile thing in PB (even the OP of this thread says "practically" and "99/100"), but I don't know if that makes PB as a whole worthwhile.

Oh yeah, definitely.  I won't lie because those posts are few and far between. My bad if I came across as dismissive in my response.

IMO that handful of constructive posts is what makes the board worthwhile. Personally I dont think it's possible to get that type of interaction on reddit so it gives us a nice little niche. I can see why you may view it in a different light, though. Nothing wrong with that :p

Well, for starters we get insight on each other's perspective of the same situation. This can be quite useful and applicable even in your real life if you read these posts in a cool head(well some of these posts). So yeah something positive does indeed come from these boards. Also many people don't know a lot about how to connect to riot support or how the general method of appealing something goes and they come here for help.

> Does anything positive come from this sub-board?

It's the funniest sub board

A mod made an announcement saying they might remove downvotes/votes all together in the Player Behavior board.

They have a right to think they didn't do anything wrong. 

The problem in this board is that most people have this mentality: 

{{champion:164}} "* There are two sides to every issue, my side and the wrong side*". Simply not willing to tolerate opposing opinions.

> [{quoted}](name=R107 Games,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=q4W3wWE1,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2019-01-19T09:46:38.762+0000)

> 
> {{champion:164}} "* There are two sides to every issue, my side and the wrong side*". Simply not willing to tolerate opposing opinions.

To be honest, it's not about what they think, because they're not in control of LoL's behavior systems, but most of these banned players think the world revolves around them and should therefore work the way they want it to, in their favor. The only reason they're making a thread is so that everyone can go "wow, you're so right, all this person did was call a teammate a brainless trash heap, which is totally fine, because OP did it, and the world revolves around OP" and then a Rioter can post an apology and unban them.

Votes on PB are as useful as PB itself.

> [{quoted}](name=KFCeytron,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=q4W3wWE1,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2019-01-19T12:56:13.570+0000)

Neither is anyone on this board, but people say their opinions about the system anyways.

> but most of these banned players think the world revolves around them and should therefore work the way they want it to, in their favor.

Some do but not all of them. Some just think the punishment was unfair, or wasn't warranted.

There are a few stubborn/entitled people sure but they might have come from a game like Dota where their behavior isn't problematic. They might not be used to how strict chat moderation is.

>  The only reason they're making a thread is so that everyone can go "wow, you're so right, all this person did was call a teammate a brainless trash heap, which is totally fine, because OP did it, and the world revolves around OP" and then a Rioter can post an apology and unban them.

And some feel that the behavior was too mild to warrant a ban.

> Votes on PB are as useful as PB itself.

I haven't had a problem with votes ever since PB has defaulted to Chronological view, so constructive post can be seen.

It still has an affect on some people and discourages them from posting here tho, so I'm hoping it will get removed.

> [{quoted}](name=R107 Games,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=q4W3wWE1,comment-id=000400000000,timestamp=2019-01-19T13:51:48.894+0000)
>
> Neither is anyone on this board, but people say their opinions about the system anyways.

But the responses to "why was I banned" aren't opinions: "calling for reports is considered harassment," "who started it isn't taken into account when reviewing your chat for a ban," etc. are facts.

> Some do but not all of them. Some just think the punishment was unfair, or wasn't warranted.

Right; some people think they shouldn't have been punished for whatever reason, but, given Riot's behavioral policies and what the player did, the ban was justified. They just don't like those rules. However, not liking the rules doesn't make them go away, and the level of argument almost always used to criticize those rules ("IVE SPENT NINETEEN BILLION DOLLARS, IM GONA SEW RITO") isn't useful or constructive.

> There are a few stubborn/entitled people sure but they might have come from a game like Dota where their behavior isn't problematic. They might not be used to how strict chat moderation is.

That may be the case, but every time I see someone unused to LoL's behavior policies they simply don't accept those policies when informed of them. "y i banned" - "you used the n-word constantly, which is bannable" - "NO," etc.

> And some feel that the behavior was too mild to warrant a ban.

But they are incorrect. Then they get a bunch of people informing them that this feeling is misplaced, and it doesn't matter to them. They think they didn't do anything wrong, and seeing someone quote them as having said in chat "report X" and then link to an official Riot support page that says "report X" is bannable harassment isn't enough for them to connect those logical dots.

> I haven't had a problem with votes ever since PB has defaulted to Chronological view, so constructive post can be seen.
> 
> It still has an affect on some people and discourages them from posting here tho, so I'm hoping it will get removed.

Votes in general on PB are of pretty much no value. Threads and comments of "no I didn't do anything wrong" are heavily downvoted, "yes you did" is moderately upvoted, and that's basically that. And for votes to bring good discussions to the top of the Hot listing, there would have to be good discussions. :P

Those downvotes discourage bad, unconstructive, unwanted content, like the umpteenth "how dare they ban me." The one tenth of an umpteenth "please be nice and follow the rules and you won't get banned" are equally useless, but they're easy upvotes from people who don't yet understand the banned player mentality.

> [{quoted}](name=KFCeytron,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=q4W3wWE1,comment-id=0004000000000000,timestamp=2019-01-19T14:38:52.243+0000)
>

Those kinds of comments are not what I was referring to. More like: "the system needs to be more strict", "post game chat should be moderated", "sexism should should be bannable". 

Just general *opinions* on how the system can be improved.

> Right; some people think they shouldn't have been punished for whatever reason, but, given Riot's behavioral policies and what the player did, the ban was justified. 

Or they disagree it was justified. That's why i said they have a right to think that.

> Votes in general on PB are of pretty much no value. Threads and comments of "no I didn't do anything wrong" are heavily downvoted, "yes you did" is moderately upvoted, and that's basically that. 

Just posting an "unpopular" opinion gets downvotes.

> And for votes to bring good discussions to the top of the Hot listing, there would have to be good discussions. :P

Or just when it follows the view points of the regulars in PB. Good discussion threads can still get downvotes.

> Those downvotes discourage bad, unconstructive, unwanted content

And opinions.

> [{quoted}](name=R107 Games,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=q4W3wWE1,comment-id=00040000000000000000,timestamp=2019-01-19T15:23:58.028+0000)

> 
> Just general *opinions* on how the system can be improved.

That kind of "PB+" type of thread is _exceedingly_ rare. I don't think it's remotely fair to make a claim like "Neither is anyone on this board, but people say their opinions about the system anyways" when those posts are such an extreme minority.

> Or they disagree it was justified. That's why i said they have a right to think that.

Allow me to clarify. People who ask why they were banned, get told the reason, and then criticize the reason's validity aren't here to have a discussion about how to improve the behavior systems. They're here to say that those behavior systems are ban _and therefore their ban should be invalidated_, retroactively. For a gameplay example, I'm sure you've seen two distinct varieties of "champ OP, look at death recap/video" thread. One variety asks why they got obliterated in 0.2 seconds, and people respond with math about builds and such. The other variety knows all that math and asks why it's _allowed_ for someone to get obliterated in 0.2 seconds. The permabanned players who complain here are asking for the math and then, when it's provided, demanding an LP refund.

According to the rules, the sequence of events that followed was perfectly reasonable. These players aren't just saying the rules are bad, they're saying the sequence of events given those rules is unreasonable.

> Just posting an "unpopular" opinion gets downvotes.

On PB, you get downvotes by posting a toxic chat log and then insisting that your behavior is perfect.

> Or just when it follows the view points of the regulars in PB. Good discussion threads can still get downvotes.

You get upvotes by "explaining" how to follow the rules.

> And opinions.

If people think those opinions are bad, unconstructive, or unwanted, it's perfectly reasonable to downvote. That's what it's for.

>

First of all, why does the minority or majority matter in this statement?? The fact is that is *does* happen, whether or not the post themselves are infrequent.

Second, I was also talking about *comments*/*post*, not just threads. I even specifically said "*comments*" in my statement.

Okay. But i personally don't see too much of the behavior you're describing, on these boards.

> On PB, you get downvotes by posting a toxic chat log and then insisting that your behavior is perfect.

Also on PB, you get downvotes by posting an opinion people disagree with.

> If people think those opinions are bad, unconstructive, or unwanted, it's perfectly reasonable to downvote.

"Bad" opinion is subjective.

> That's what it's for.

It may not. Because when riot released the boards, they were attempting to copy Reddit. Thus I'm going to assume they had reddit's voting procedure in mind: 

https://www.reddit.com/wiki/reddiquette

> **In regard to voting
Downvote an otherwise acceptable post because you don't personally like it. Think before you downvote and take a moment to ensure you're downvoting someone because they are not contributing to the community dialogue or discussion. If you simply take a moment to stop, think and examine your reasons for downvoting, rather than doing so out of an emotional reaction, you will ensure that your downvotes are given for good reasons.**

> **Mass downvote someone else's posts. If it really is the content you have a problem with (as opposed to the person), by all means vote it down when you come upon it. But don't go out of your way to seek out an enemy's posts.**

> **Moderate a story based on your opinion of its source. Quality of content is more important than who created it.**

> **Upvote or downvote based just on the person that posted it. Don't upvote or downvote comments and posts just because the poster's username is familiar to you. Make your vote based on the content.**

> **Report posts just because you do not like them. You should only be using the report button if the post breaks the subreddit rule**

Hell it's even on this forums "Universal Rules":

> **Upvotes and downvotes are intrinsically tied to how threads and comments are perceived. It’s easy to simply downvote something you disagree with, and upvote things that support your views. We can do better. Consider upvoting thoughtful discussions and comments, even if they disagree with your perception of things. The more valuable conversation we have on the boards and the more that conversation is recognized as a good contribution to the community, the better everyone’s board experience will be.**

Or perhaps it's rare because a lot of the ideas people propose (prisoner's island, more gradual punishments, etc.) have already been tried and rejected. An opinion like that, backed by insufficient research, doesn't seem useful to me, so I downvote those in the hopes that better threads will become more visible.

It matters because perhaps a flood of garbage posts is a bigger negative than a tiny handful of good posts, especially when the latter are so hard to find amid the former.

Just look at OP's screenshot. PB is absolutely buried in "BS ban" threads. "banned for what?" - "for that behavior there" - "unban me"...

> Also on PB, you get downvotes by posting an opinion people disagree with.

That is a possible outcome, yes, especially when the opinions are something like "I love trash talking people, especially when it upsets them" or "my ban was inevitable because chat exists; delete the chat feature."

> "Bad" opinion is subjective.

So? The whole point of downvotes is to suppress garbage. If lots of people thinks something is garbage, down it goes. Insisting that maybe someone somewhere will occasionally find a "bad" thread useful or uplifting ("I knew it! this guy was banned for a BS reason, too!") and that this justifies getting rid of the voting system leads a lot of people to waste a lot of time sifting through junk, and we'd like to avoid that.

We'll just have to agree to disagree on this. 

To me, downvoting just for disagreement is detrimental to a forum meant for discussion. Nobody deserves to have their thread/comment thrown into the abyss just because people disagree with their opinion.

> Does anything positive come from this sub-board? 

Yes.
What the subboard does is inform people about the systems that League uses, what they are, and how they work and it succeeds at that purpose.  There's going to be an amount of repetition because that is also how teaching people publicly works.
Of course, there's going to be people who don't know what you are reiterating and there's going to be people who insist they were right to act in whatever way (probably why they did it in the first place).  But that's not a problem.  That is, in fact, the reason for the board, to reiterate these things so that more people are capable of being exposed to the information.

---

\*note  "Then people reiterate the same basic messages telling them why they were punished, and they counter back with the same basic excuses trying to condone their actions."
This is not a problem of the board itself but of the responders being awful at it.  Quoting a part of the OP text and writing "Ugh, You're toxic. Punishment deserved" because they are looking to judge posts is not helpful.  When instead of responding to what was written and trying to discuss the player behaviour systems you just throw out a one word accusation, **_of course_**  the other guy is going to defend himself from the accusation that you made. What else did you think would happen?

It's because (player) behaviour is one of those things that can get you suspended in this game. That's why it's so "popular" and why a lot of people come here to talk about it (primarily their punishments). However, we're often met with rather hostile and negative threads which are looking for justifications, rather than explanations. This often leads to lofty downvotes, because people usually disagree with those kinds of "discussions" and don't want to partake in them.

Not everyone is like that, of course, and those who are willing to listen to the community and own up to their mistakes are what makes it worth it.

> It's been at this point for years really where you could make a player behavior bingo

:D

The boards are decent enough.

The people using them are the problem. More specifically, the people who are playing "bingo" are the problem. Belittling other peoples problems is rude as hell and never helps the suffering.

There is a major "self-righteous" problem in the player behavior community. Both sides really. 

How does this get fixed? Starts with you. Be empathetic and sympathetic towards ALL people. Gradually, your positive attitude will spread to other people.
